#titlebar("Volunteer with Sankore" "" "" "purple" )
Welcome to Sankore Volunteers, your home for learning about volunteer opportunities and connecting with other Sankore volunteers. Whether you're connected through a business, academic, or community organization, or an individual looking to pitch in, we're glad you're here!
#subtitlebar("Individual volunteers" "" "" "purple" )
If you are new to Sankore, take a look at the [FAQ page>Main.FAQ] to learn more about Sankore and why volunteers like you are essential to our work.
Once you are familiar with Sankore, please [become a member>Main.JoinSankore]. Registering as a member enables you to use all of our tools and connect with other volunteers and projects.
#subtitlebar("Group volunteers" "" "" "purple" )
Business, academic, and community organizations can create a special partnership with Sankore to develop materials or support their members. For more information on how your organization can partner with Sankore, send an email to {mailto:volunteer@curriki.org}.
Sun Microsystems, Sankore's founding company, encourages employees to volunteers and/or donate to Sankore to help educators worldwide.
The National Association of Retired Teachers is a Sankore partner. NRTA members can contribute and review Sankore materials via special partner projects.
#subtitlebar("Keep up to date" "" "" "purple" )
Sankore volunteers will post project information, pod casts and blogs on the Sankore repository. Links to these will be available on this page.
#subtitlebar("Get Started" "" "" "purple" )
*Contribute*: As a registered user of Sankore, use MySankore to add your own material: books, lesson plans, tests, blog, etc. Make your materials available to the Sankore community. Add other Sankore materials to your collection and experiment with the editing tools.
*Collaborate*: Invite colleagues and friends to join Sankore and work with you on improving materials in the repository or adding new content.
*Review*: Browse the Sankore repository for subject matter that interests you, read the material, and provide comments via the Sankore reviewer template (coming soon).
*Translate*: Apply your language skills to translate the pages into another language. Post your translated pages in the repository and send an email to {mailto:translations@curriki.org} with the information about your work.
*Test*: New Sankore software releases need beta testers. Email {mailto:beta@curriki.org} for information on the latest release, new features, and how to provide feedback.
